items.title: Kechish uchun 1 yil: AI-80 benziniga qarshi reydlar boshlandi
items.summary: Ikki kun oldin O‘zenergoinspeksiya matbuot xizmati O‘zbekistondagi avtomobillarga yoqilg‘i quyish shoxobchalarida AI-80 benzini savdosiga qarshi reydlar boshlanganini ma’lum qildi. Xo‘sh, endi AI-80 y...
items.full_content:
Ikki kun oldin O‘zenergoinspeksiya matbuot xizmati O‘zbekistondagi avtomobillarga yoqilg‘i quyish shoxobchalarida AI-80 benzini savdosiga qarshi reydlar boshlanganini ma’lum qildi. Xo‘sh, endi AI-80 yo‘qmi? Benzinning taqiqlanish jarayoni qanday kechdi?

Prezident topshirig‘i

Yil boshida Shavkat Mirziyoyev “O‘zbekiston-2030” strategiyasini joriy yilga mo‘ljallangan davlat dasturi to‘g‘risidagi farmonni qabul qilgan edi. Davlat dasturida 2025-yil yakuniga qadar aholini sifatli, ekologik toza va arzon yoqilg‘I bilan ta’minlagan holda AI-80 rusumli avtomobil yoqilg‘isidan foydalanish va sotish cheklanishi belgilangan edi. 

Umuman olganda, farmon loyihasida Yevro-4 ekologik standartidan past bo‘lgan yoqilg‘ini to‘liq taqiqlash haqida so‘z borgan. Masalan, AI-80 benzini Yevro-2 standartiga mos keladi

Buning ortidan, Mirziyoyev 2025-yil oxirigacha AI-80 rusumli avtomobil yoqilg‘isidan foydalanish va sotishni cheklash, aholini “sifatli, ekologik toza va arzon yoqilg‘i” bilan ta’minlash uchun “barcha kuch va vositalarni safarbar etish” bo‘yicha topshiriq bergan.

AI-80 ishlab chiqarishni to‘xtatish rejasi

Shundan so‘ng, iyul oyida O‘zbekneftgaz yuqori oktanli avtomobil benzini (AI-92) ishlab chiqarish hajmini oshirishni rejalashtirayotganini ma’lum qilgandi. Bundan kelib chiqib, AI-80 markasini ishlab chiqarishni to‘liq to‘xtatish sentyabr oyiga mo‘ljallangan edi.

O‘sha paytdagi ma’lumotlarga ko‘ra, Buxoro neftni qayta ishlash zavodi 2025-yilda jami 1,03 mln tonna yoqilg‘i ishlab chiqarishni rejalashtirgan. Buning 487 ming tonnasi AI-80 va 543 ming tonnasi AI-92+ benzini bo‘lishi ma’lum qilingandi. Shuningdek, AI-80 avtobenzinini sentabrgacha ishlab chiqarish, sentyabrdan boshlab esa faqat AI-92+ avtobenzinini (oyiga o‘rtacha 90 ming tonna) ishlab chiqarish ko‘zda tutilgan.

Natijada joriy yilning o‘zida O‘zbekneftgaz omborlarida AI-80 avtobenzin zaxiralari to‘liq tugatilishi, 2026 yildan esa faqat yuqori oktanli avtobenzin (AI-92 va AI-95) sotishga o‘tilishi rejalasht

items.title: Международные резервы Узбекистана достигли рекордных $61,2 млрд
items.summary: Общий объем международных активов Узбекистана на 1 декабря 2025 года обновил исторический максимум, достигнув $61,23 млрд. Об этом свидетельствуют данные Центрального банка. За последний месяц междуна...
items.full_content: Общий объем международных активов Узбекистана на 1 декабря 2025 года обновил исторический максимум, достигнув $61,23 млрд. Об этом свидетельствуют данные Центрального банка. За последний месяц международные активы республики увеличились на $1,89 млрд, или 3,2%. С начала текущего года прирост составил 48,69%. Стоимость золота в хранилищах ЦБ пятый месяц подряд обновляет рекорд, составив $50,85 млрд.Источник

items.title: Uzbekistan, China deepen technological partnership as President Mirziyoyev meets leading companies - Daryo.uz
items.summary: Uzbekistan and its Chinese partners are currently implementing more than 30 energy projects with a combined capacity of nearly 10 gigawatts, valued at over $9bn, according to the presidential press se...
items.full_content:
Uzbekistan and its Chinese partners are currently implementing more than 30 energy projects with a combined capacity of nearly 10 gigawatts, valued at over $9bn, according to the presidential press service.

On December 5, President Shavkat Mirziyoyev met with the heads of leading Chinese companies to review progress and outline new areas of cooperation.

Officials noted the growing interest of Chinese companies, highlighting that more than $15bn in Chinese direct investment is expected to be utilized this year. The overall portfolio of joint projects has now reached nearly $90bn.

During the talks, special attention was given to the energy sector as a key driver of bilateral cooperation. On the same day, an additional 14 new projects worth nearly $2bn were launched, further expanding the partnership’s scope.

In the meeting with China Datang President Zhou Yuanlong, the sides discussed expanding and constructing new photovoltaic power plants and increasing energy storage capacities. China Datang’s plans to support workforce development, establish a scientific laboratory, and introduce renewable energy technologies in agriculture and livestock sectors received the President’s support.

President Mirziyoyev also met with Lu Xu of China Energy Engineering Corporation, where both sides praised the joint work on solar power plants and energy storage systems across Uzbekistan’s regions. The importance of accelerating renewable projects and developing high-voltage networks was emphasized.

Sinoma Energy Chairman Meng Qinglin presented updates on the construction of a major wind power plant and a plant to localize wind turbine blade production. Discussions also covered technological solutions to reduce industrial emissions in the chemical and construction sectors. The President stressed the need to speed up implementation of these projects.

Further measures to accelerate wind power plant construction were discussed with Universal Energy Chairman Nan Yi.

Kang Hubiao, Chai

items.title: Uzbekistan, UAE discuss expansion of cooperation and major joint investments - Daryo.uz
items.summary: President of Uzbekistan Shavkat Mirziyoyev held talks on December 5 with a high-level delegation from the United Arab Emirates led by Suhail Al Mazrouei, Minister of Energy and Infrastructure, to asse...
items.full_content:
President of Uzbekistan Shavkat Mirziyoyev held talks on December 5 with a high-level delegation from the United Arab Emirates led by Suhail Al Mazrouei, Minister of Energy and Infrastructure, to assess progress on major joint investment projects.

The meeting was attended by senior executives of leading Emirati companies, including Masdar CEO Mohamed Jameel Al Ramahi, Etihad Water & Electricity CEO Yousif Al Ali, and TAQA Water Solutions CEO Ahmad Al Shamsi.

At the outset, Minister Al Mazrouei conveyed the greetings of UAE President Sheikh Mohamed Al Nahyan, Vice President and Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed Al Maktoum, and Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Khaled Al Nahyan.

The two sides discussed the continued expansion of Uzbek–Emirati cooperation, noting steady growth in trade, joint ventures, and direct flights. The bilateral investment portfolio has now reached $20bn.

Discussions focused on advancing projects in priority sectors such as transport and logistics, food production, mining and metallurgy, and energy. Officials highlighted successful collaboration in the energy sector, where six projects worth $1.5bn have been implemented in recent years with Masdar.

On the same day, Uzbekistan commissioned a new solar power plant and an energy storage system in the Bukhara region, while construction began on similar facilities in Kashkadarya valued at over $600mn.

Company representatives briefed President Mirziyoyev on upcoming initiatives, including plans to build a wind power plant, expand energy storage capacities, develop hydropower facilities, and advance wastewater treatment projects.

items.title: Magnitude 4.5 Earthquake Strikes Namangan Region of Uzbekistan - UzDaily.uz
items.summary:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — On 6 December 2025, at 02:04 local time, a magnitude 4.5 earthquake occurred in the Pap district of Namangan region of Uzbekistan.

The earthquake’s hypocenter was...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — On 6 December 2025, at 02:04 local time, a magnitude 4.5 earthquake occurred in the Pap district of Namangan region of Uzbekistan.

The earthquake’s hypocenter was at a depth of 17 km, with the epicenter located at coordinates 40.89 N, 70.75 E.

The intensity of the tremors reached 5 points at the epicenter. Neighboring regions felt the tremors as follows: Namangan Region — 3 points, Fergana — 2–3 points, Andijan — 2 points, Tashkent — 2 points, Syrdarya — 2 points.

The epicenter is situated approximately 135 km southeast of the capital, Tashkent. No reports of damage or casualties have been received so far. Local authorities continue to monitor the situation.

items.title: Taylor Swift ikkinchi, The Weeknd esa uchinchi: 2025-yilning eng mashhur qo‘shiqchisi kim?
items.summary: Spotify 2025-yilning yakuniy reytingini e’lon qildi. Unga ko‘ra, Taylor Swift bu yil 2-o‘rinni egalladi, The Weeknd esa 3-o‘rinda. 4-o‘rinni Drake, 5-o‘rinni bo‘lsa Billie Eilish band qildi. Joriy yil...
items.full_content:
Spotify 2025-yilning yakuniy reytingini e’lon qildi. Unga ko‘ra, Taylor Swift bu yil 2-o‘rinni egalladi, The Weeknd esa 3-o‘rinda. 4-o‘rinni Drake, 5-o‘rinni bo‘lsa Billie Eilish band qildi. Joriy yilning eng yaxshi qo‘shiqchisi sifatida Bad Bunny birinchi o‘rinni egalladi. 

2025-yilning eng mashhur albomi

Spotify ma’lumotlariga ko‘ra, Bad Bunnyning “DeBÍ TiRAR MáS FOToS”i yilning eng mashhur albomi bo‘ldi, undan keyin “KPop Demon Hunters” saundtreki va Billie Eilishning “Hit Me Hard and Soft” albomi joylashdi. Qo‘shiqlar orasida eng ko‘p tinglangani Lady Gaga va Bruno Marsning “Die with a Smile” kompozitsiyasi bo‘ldi. Yetakchilar qatoriga Billie Eilishning “Birds of a Feather” hamda Rose va Bruno Marsning “APT.” hit qo‘shig‘i ham kirdi.

Eng mashhur qo‘shiqchilarning to‘liq ro‘yxati

items.title: Uzbekistan and Germany’s Foreign Ministers Discuss Expansion of Cooperation - UzDaily.uz
items.summary: Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — On 4 December in Vienna, Uzbekistan’s Foreign Minister Bakhtiyor Saidov held a meeting with German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul on the sidelines of the OSCE Mi...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — On 4 December in Vienna, Uzbekistan’s Foreign Minister Bakhtiyor Saidov held a meeting with German Foreign Minister Johann Wadephul on the sidelines of the OSCE Ministerial Council.

The two sides noted the positive dynamics of bilateral cooperation and reaffirmed their commitment to further strengthening the partnership.

The talks focused on expanding cooperation in trade, investment, green energy, vocational education, and connectivity.

The ministers discussed promising areas of economic cooperation and measures to enhance the resilience of supply chains.

Saidov and Wadephul also exchanged views on key international and regional issues, addressed current challenges in security and sustainable development, and aligned their approaches to upcoming bilateral and multilateral events.

items.title: Yandex Go Launches Intercity Delivery Across Uzbekistan - UzDaily.uz
items.summary:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — Yandex Go has expanded its functionality by launching a new intercity delivery service across Uzbekistan.

Users can now send parcels to other cities through Marke...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — Yandex Go has expanded its functionality by launching a new intercity delivery service across Uzbekistan.

Users can now send parcels to other cities through Market Yandex Go pickup points — the entire process is handled in the app, and delivery takes as little as one day.

How the new service works

To send an item, users need to select the “Across Uzbekistan” tab in the “Delivery” section.

The system will then prompt them to enter the sender’s and recipient’s details, choose pickup points for dispatch and collection, and select the parcel category:

S — up to 2 kg

M — up to 5 kg

L — up to 12 kg

After completing the order, the user simply brings the parcel to the chosen pickup point. The recipient will be able to collect it after receiving a notification in the app.

At launch, delivery is available between four cities: Tashkent, Samarkand, Bukhara, and Ferghana. The company notes that the service geography will continue to expand.

Service cost

The first three shipments will cost users 4,500 soums, while subsequent ones will be 9,500 soums.

The tariff is fixed and does not depend on distance or direction. Payment is made by card in the app, with additional payment options to be introduced soon.

items.title: Uzbekistan Participates in Discussion on Combating Transnational Repression in Geneva - UzDaily.uz
items.summary: Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — On 4 December 2025, the United Nations held an intersessional event at the Palais des Nations in Geneva titled “Transnational Repression and the Undermining of Hum...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — On 4 December 2025, the United Nations held an intersessional event at the Palais des Nations in Geneva titled “Transnational Repression and the Undermining of Human Rights: Global Responses and Accountability,” organized by the Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR).

The meeting brought together representatives of member states, international organizations, UN Human Rights Council mandate holders, and expert bodies.

The main objective of the event was to deepen understanding of the various forms of transnational repression, assess their impact on the protection of human rights, and develop effective mechanisms for safeguarding rights and ensuring accountability.

The event opened with remarks by Canada’s Permanent Representative to the UN, Peter MacDougall. Among the participants were leading international experts, including OHCHR Director of Thematic Engagement Peggy Hicks; UN Special Rapporteurs Irene Khan and Nazila Ghanea; representatives of Human Rights Watch, Article 19; and relevant institutions from Canada and Germany.

Uzbekistan was represented by Akmal Saidov, Director of the National Human Rights Centre and member of the UN Human Rights Committee.

He stressed the importance of building an international consensus to counter transnational repression, which threatens freedom of expression, freedom of association, and personal security. He emphasized the need for systematic cooperation among states, international mechanisms, and civil society to protect journalists and human rights defenders, in line with the provisions of Uzbekistan’s revised Constitution.

Participants noted that transnational repression is becoming increasingly systemic, fostering an atmosphere of fear and self-censorship among victims and their families.

OHCHR reports highlighted persistent impunity due to the absence of effective safeguards and limited access to justice. Discussions focused on enhancing national and internat

items.title: Uzbek Translation of Bakhtiyar Vahabzade’s Book Presented in Ferghana - UzDaily.uz
items.summary: Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — As part of the “Azerbaijan Art and Literature Days” program, implemented by the Heydar Aliyev Azerbaijan Cultural Center under the Embassy of Azerbaijan in Uzbekis...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — As part of the “Azerbaijan Art and Literature Days” program, implemented by the Heydar Aliyev Azerbaijan Cultural Center under the Embassy of Azerbaijan in Uzbekistan, Ferghana State University hosted the presentation of the book “Jonimga jo – Ozarbayjonim” by Azerbaijan’s People’s Poet Bakhtiyar Vahabzade.

The event was dedicated to the 100th anniversary of the birth of the prominent poet, playwright, and public figure.

Speakers noted that the book had been translated into Uzbek and published as part of a project by the Azerbaijan Cultural Center.

The publication has become an important cultural milestone, offering a wider audience an opportunity to engage more deeply with Bakhtiyar Vahabzade’s creative legacy while strengthening the spiritual ties between the peoples of the two countries.

The event was opened by the First Vice-Rector of Ferghana State University, Doctor of Philology Zakir Rakhimov. He emphasized that academic and literary cooperation between Uzbekistan and Azerbaijan has significantly intensified in recent years, and that Vahabzade’s work continues to bring readers and researchers of both nations closer together.

In his address, Akif Marifli, Director of the Azerbaijan Cultural Center, noted that the dynamic development of relations between Uzbekistan and Azerbaijan is a result of the political will and strategic vision of the presidents of both countries.

According to him, the translation of “Jonimga jo – Ozarbayjonim” into Uzbek is an important step in promoting Vahabzade’s legacy among a new literary audience.

Marifli stressed that Bakhtiyar Vahabzade’s poetry reflects the spiritual aspirations of the Azerbaijani people, as well as ideas of national consciousness, Turkic identity, and unity — themes that remain relevant today.

The discussion also featured contributions from scholars and representatives of the creative community, including Professor Khabibullo Juraev, Professor Erkin Nuriddinov of UzN

items.title: Bank Employee in Surkhandarya Detained for Accepting Bribe in Loan Issuance Case - UzDaily.uz
items.summary: Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — An employee of the Surkhandarya regional branch of JSCB Business Development Bank has been detained by law-enforcement officers while receiving a bribe of US$2,000...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — An employee of the Surkhandarya regional branch of JSCB Business Development Bank has been detained by law-enforcement officers while receiving a bribe of US$2,000 and 1 million 300 thousand soums.

The information was reported by the press service of Uzbekistan’s State Security Service (SSS).

According to the agency, the bank employee had promised a citizen that he would “resolve” the issue of securing a loan for a resident of Shurchi district.

The applicant had previously applied for a loan of 17 billion soums, but the employee informed him that the collateral property, according to the “Electronic Appraisal” system, lacked sufficient value.

He then demanded money from the applicant, assuring him that he could “fix” the situation.

A criminal case has been opened against the detained employee under Part 3, Clause “v” of Article 168 of the Criminal Code of the Republic of Uzbekistan (“Fraud”). Investigative procedures are ongoing.

items.title: Azerbaijan and Uzbekistan Sign Emergency Ministries’ Action Plan for 2026–2027 - UzDaily.uz
items.summary: Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — Azerbaijan’s Minister of Emergency Situations, Colonel-General Kamaladdin Heydarov, held a meeting with Uzbekistan’s Minister of Emergency Situations, Major-Genera...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — Azerbaijan’s Minister of Emergency Situations, Colonel-General Kamaladdin Heydarov, held a meeting with Uzbekistan’s Minister of Emergency Situations, Major-General Botir Kudratkhodjayev.

The talks took place in Baku on the sidelines of the 26th International Conference of Fire and Rescue Service Leaders of the member states of the International Association of Fire and Rescue Services (CTIF).

Welcoming the Uzbek delegation, Heydarov emphasized that relations between the two countries, rooted in deep historical ties, have in recent years risen to the level of a strategic partnership.

He noted that close cooperation between the ministries continues to strengthen against the backdrop of a trusting dialogue between President of Azerbaijan Ilham Aliyev and President of Uzbekistan Shavkat Mirziyoyev.

The parties discussed expanding collaboration in preventing and responding to emergencies, personnel training, and sharing best practices.

The Azerbaijani minister expressed confidence that the agreements reached would serve as a solid basis for further deepening cooperation.

Botir Kudratkhodjayev thanked the hosts for their hospitality and the high level of organization of the conference.

He stated that cooperation between the ministries is developing dynamically, contributing to improved public safety and strengthening the resilience of territories to natural and man-made risks.

The negotiations concluded with the signing of a Joint Action Plan for 2026–2027 between the emergency ministries of the two countries.

The document formalizes agreements on coordination, experience-sharing, and joint initiatives in the field of civil protection.

Following the meeting, the Uzbek delegation familiarized itself with the work of Azerbaijan’s Crisis Management Center, the departments responsible for digital technologies and innovation development, as well as the Ministry’s public relations service.

As part of the visit, Kudratkhodjayev wil

items.title: Uzbekistan and Hungary Discuss Implementation of Smart City Model in Samarkand - UzDaily.uz
items.summary: Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — Hungary’s Minister of Public Administration and Regional Development Tibor Navracsics, who is visiting Uzbekistan, traveled to Samarkand where he held talks with t...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — Hungary’s Minister of Public Administration and Regional Development Tibor Navracsics, who is visiting Uzbekistan, traveled to Samarkand where he held talks with the regional governor Adiz Boboev.

The parties noted that cooperation between the two countries has been steadily strengthening, with achieved results made possible thanks to the close and trusting relationship between the leaders of Uzbekistan and Hungary.

During the meeting, the sides discussed the prospects of introducing the Hungarian “Smart City” model in Samarkand, as well as issues related to improving administrative efficiency, modernizing public-sector processes, and digitalizing the city’s infrastructure.

Boboev stated that the city is rapidly developing and is approaching a population of one million, which requires a comprehensive approach to urban planning and the creation of a comfortable urban environment.

Special attention was given to exchanging experience in the reconstruction of historical sites and the use of digital technologies in city management.

Navracsics expressed support for Uzbekistan’s initiatives and proposed exploring the possibility of establishing sister-region partnerships between Samarkand region and Hungarian cities.

The sides agreed to jointly develop this direction.

Following the talks, the parties also preliminarily agreed to hold a business forum in Hungary with the participation of entrepreneurs and to implement several joint projects.

items.title: Chinese Company to Modernize 170 km of Roads and Build a Tunnel in Tashkent - UzDaily.uz
items.summary: Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — A large-scale project to modernize Tashkent’s transport infrastructure will be implemented over the next four years with the participation of China Construction Fi...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — A large-scale project to modernize Tashkent’s transport infrastructure will be implemented over the next four years with the participation of China Construction Fifth Engineering Division Co., Ltd., according to the Roadmap for establishing an efficient transport management system in the capital.

The total cost of the works, financed through loans from the Bank of China under Uzbekistan’s state guarantees, exceeds US$270 million.

As part of the first stage, the plan includes the repair and upgrade of a three-kilometer section of Shakhrisabz Street, with the introduction of a dedicated bus lane and improvements to the surrounding road infrastructure.

The project is scheduled for completion in September 2026, with a cost of US$6 million. The stage also includes modernization of an 11-kilometer section of Amir Temur Avenue and 5.5 kilometers of Yangi Sergeli Street, both with dedicated bus lanes and infrastructure upgrades. These works are expected to be completed by November 2026, with a budget of US$16.5 million.

In addition, 38 kilometers of Mukhtumkuli Street; Mirzo Ulugbek – Feruza – Yuzrabot; Lutfi; Muqimi; Nurafshon; Karatash – Kukcha Darvoza; and the Tashkent Ring Road – Parkent corridor will undergo repair and modernization, including the installation of bus lanes and upgrades to roadside infrastructure.

The cost of this stage is US$76 million, with implementation planned for 2026–2029.

The second stage includes repairs and upgrades of 36 kilometers of road surface and related infrastructure across 16 streets, with a project value of US$36.5 million. These works are scheduled for completion within 2026.

This stage also includes the construction of an overpass on the Small Ring Road, connecting Pakhlavon Street with Elbek Street near ZO‘R TV. The cost of construction is US$25.4 million, with completion expected in December 2026.

The third stage provides for the repair and modernization of 33 kilometers of roads and i

items.title: Uzbekistan advances renewable and grid development with commissioning of 42 facilities - Daryo.uz
items.summary: Uzbekistan expanded its national energy program on December 5 as President Shavkat Mirziyoyev inaugurated 42 new energy facilities and launched the construction of 21 additional projects aimed at stre...
items.full_content:
Uzbekistan expanded its national energy program on December 5 as President Shavkat Mirziyoyev inaugurated 42 new energy facilities and launched the construction of 21 additional projects aimed at strengthening generation capacity, grid stability, and renewable energy development.

The event in Tashkent brought together ministers from the UAE, Turkiye, Azerbaijan, and Kyrgyzstan, along with representatives of the World Bank, EBRD, ADB, AIIB, IsDB, and global energy companies including ACWA Power, Masdar, TotalEnergies, Siemens Energy, China Energy, Datang, and EDF.

$11bn in New Energy Assets

Uzbekistan commissioned 42 new generation, storage, and industrial facilities worth a combined $11bn. These include 16 solar, wind, thermal, and hydropower plants totaling 3.5 GW located in Karakalpakstan and the Bukhara, Kashkadarya, and Tashkent regions.

Once fully operational, the new plants will generate around 15bn kWh of electricity annually. The country expects its overall green energy production to reach 23bn kWh next year, covering national electricity demand. The growth in renewables will save nearly 7bn cubic meters of natural gas and avoid 11mn tons of emissions.

Energy Storage and Grid Modernization

Ten energy storage systems with a total capacity of 1,245 MW are being put into operation, enabling an additional 1.5bn kWh of electricity to be supplied during peak hours.

Uzbekistan is also commissioning 11 new substations and 420 km of high-voltage power lines to support stable grid operations.

Two new manufacturing enterprises — Angren Energo and Uzhydropower — will produce transformers and hydro units, supplying equipment for domestic energy projects.

Recent Progress in the Energy Sector

President Mirziyoyev noted that Uzbekistan has attracted $35bn in foreign investment into the energy sector in recent years, commissioning 9,000 MW of new capacity. Annual electricity production has increased from 60bn kWh in 2017 to 85bn kWh in 2024.

Renewable energy proje

items.title: UzHydromet Warns of Avalanche Risk in Uzbekistan’s Mountains - UzDaily.uz
items.summary: Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — According to UzHydromet, avalanche danger is expected in the country’s foothill and mountainous areas from December 6 to 9 due to upcoming precipitation and sharp ...
items.full_content:
Tashkent, Uzbekistan (UzDaily.com) — According to UzHydromet, avalanche danger is expected in the country’s foothill and mountainous areas from December 6 to 9 due to upcoming precipitation and sharp temperature fluctuations.

The risk has been forecast for the following regions:

Tashkent Region — Akhangaran, Bostanlyk, and Parkent districts (Chatkal mountain range)

Namangan Region — Pap district

Residents of foothill and mountain areas, tourists, and drivers planning trips to these regions are advised to exercise caution and avoid hazardous routes.

items.full_content: Схема размещения интегрированной атомной электростанции демонстрирует планы по возведению четырех реакторов большой мощности на базе технологии ВВЭР-1000. Соответствующие данные приводятся в репортаже телеканала Oʻzbekiston 24 и стратегии Министерства энергетики. Согласно обнародованному плану, каждый из четырех блоков будет оснащен двумя градирнями. Помимо основных мощностей...Источник

items.summary: Узбекистан планирует к 2035 году вдвое снизить выбросы парниковых газов, а также масштабировать проекты «зеленой» энергетики на уровне махаллей и регионов. Об этом заявил Шавкат Мирзиёев на церемонии ...
items.full_content: Узбекистан планирует к 2035 году вдвое снизить выбросы парниковых газов, а также масштабировать проекты «зеленой» энергетики на уровне махаллей и регионов. Об этом заявил Шавкат Мирзиёев на церемонии запуска новых мощностей, передает пресс-служба главы государства. В следующем году в республике запустят проект по установке солнечных станций в 300 махаллях на основе китайского опыта.Источник

items.title: Uzbekistan plans to convert some landfills into green spaces
items.summary: The readiness of waste-to-energy plants in Uzbekistan currently stands at around 40%. They are planned to be completed in six regions by the end of 2026. The launch of these facilities will help reduc...
items.full_content: The readiness of waste-to-energy plants in Uzbekistan currently stands at around 40%. They are planned to be completed in six regions by the end of 2026. The launch of these facilities will help reduce the number of landfills and convert them into environmentally safe zones.
